item.title: Managing Python on Mac OS
item.description: Summary It’s easy to install multiple versions of python on a Mac computer using installers from python.org, Homebrew, Conda, or other sources. This could create conflicts if a user wants to run one version of python but bash calls a different version instead. This is guide will show you how to: modify your bash profile to change which version of python is called by bash first. use virtual environments to specify a version of python that will run a project.
